hero.title: Genetics for pet keepers
hero.subtitle: Coat color and pattern can be fun, but they are only one layer on top of temperament, health and structure.

body.text: Most visible traits, such as coat color or pattern, are controlled by combinations of genes. Each gene can have different versions, called alleles, which interact with each other in predictable ways.

items: Genotype is the combination of alleles a rat carries.
Phenotype is what we can see or measure from the outside.
Some traits are dominant, some are recessive, and many are more complex.

body.text: It is tempting to focus on rare colors or patterns. However, color genetics does not guarantee good temperament, strong health or ethical breeding decisions.

At Ratopia, we use genetics as a supporting tool. For example, we may plan a pairing that both stabilizes temperament and also introduces a color we like, but we will not compromise core values just to reach a visual goal.
